statements: SELECT * FROM communications WHERE sender_id = 1;
SELECT id, sender_id, receiver_id FROM communications WHERE receiver_id = 2;
SELECT message FROM communications WHERE sender_id = 3 AND receiver_id = 4;
SELECT id, message, sent_timestamp FROM communications ORDER BY sent_timestamp DESC;
SELECT * FROM communications WHERE sender_id = 5 AND sent_timestamp > '2022-01-01';
SELECT id, sender_id, receiver_id, message, sent_timestamp FROM communications WHERE sender_id = 1 AND receiver_id = 2 ORDER BY sent_timestamp DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT * FROM communications WHERE sender_id = 3 AND receiver_id = 4 ORDER BY sent_timestamp ASC;
SELECT sender_id, receiver_id, count(*) AS message_count FROM communications GROUP BY sender_id, receiver_id;
SELECT DISTINCT sender_id, receiver_id FROM communications ORDER BY sender_id DESC, receiver_id ASC;
SELECT message, sent_timestamp FROM communications WHERE sender_id = 5 OR receiver_id = 5 ORDER BY sent_timestamp DESC LIMIT 10;
SELECT * FROM communications WHERE sender = 'Alice'
SELECT message, timestamp FROM communications WHERE receiver = 'Bob' ORDER BY timestamp DESC
SELECT id, message, sender FROM communications WHERE sender IN ('Alice', 'Bob')
SELECT * FROM departments WHERE location = 'New York' AND department_name LIKE '%Sales%'
SELECT sender AS From, receiver AS To, timestamp AS Sent FROM communications
SELECT * FROM communications WHERE sender = 'Alice' AND receiver = 'Bob'
SELECT message, timestamp FROM communications ORDER BY timestamp DESC
SELECT sender, receiver, COUNT(*) AS message_count FROM communications GROUP BY sender, receiver
SELECT * FROM communications WHERE id IN (1, 3, 5)
SELECT * FROM departments WHERE location = 'New York'
SELECT * FROM Department;
SELECT department_name, department_id FROM Department ORDER BY department_name DESC;
SELECT employee_id, employee_name, employee_position FROM Employee WHERE employee_position='Manager';
SELECT log_date, log_description FROM CommunicationLog WHERE log_date >= '2022-01-01';
SELECT employee_name, log_description FROM Employee JOIN CommunicationLog ON Employee.employee_id = CommunicationLog.employee_id;
SELECT * FROM Department;
SELECT employee_name, employee_position FROM Employee ORDER BY employee_name DESC;
SELECT log_date, log_description FROM CommunicationLog WHERE log_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-12-31';
SELECT Employee.employee_name, Department.department_name FROM Employee INNER JOIN Department ON Employee.employee_department_id = Department.department_id;
SELECT COUNT(*), employee_position FROM Employee GROUP BY employee_position HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;
SELECT * FROM department;
SELECT first_name, last_name FROM employee;
SELECT message_text, message_date FROM message WHERE sender_id = 1;
SELECT notification_text, notification_date FROM notification ORDER BY notification_date DESC;
SELECT department_name, COUNT(*) AS num_employees FROM employee JOIN department ON employee.department_id = department.department_id GROUP BY department_name;
SELECT * FROM department;
SELECT employee_id, first_name, last_name FROM employee WHERE department_id = 2 ORDER BY last_name DESC;
SELECT message_text, message_date FROM message ORDER BY message_date ASC LIMIT 5;
SELECT e.first_name, e.last_name, d.department_name FROM employee e JOIN department d ON e.department_id = d.department_id WHERE e.employee_id = 3;
SELECT notification_text, notification_date FROM notification WHERE notification_date > '2022-01-01' AND notification_date < '2022-12-31';
SELECT * FROM Employee;
SELECT employee_name, department_id FROM Employee ORDER BY employee_name DESC;
SELECT department_name, COUNT(employee_id) FROM Department JOIN Employee ON Department.department_id = Employee.department_id GROUP BY department_name;
SELECT employee_name, department_name FROM Employee JOIN Department ON Employee.department_id = Department.department_id WHERE Employee.employee_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM CommunicationLog ORDER BY timestamp ASC;
SELECT * FROM Department;
SELECT employee_name, department_name FROM Employee INNER JOIN Department ON Employee.department_id = Department.department_id;
SELECT communication_id, sender_id, receiver_id, message, timestamp FROM Communication ORDER BY timestamp DESC;
SELECT department_name, employee_name AS manager_name FROM DepartmentManager INNER JOIN Employee ON DepartmentManager.manager_id = Employee.employee_id ORDER BY department_name ASC;
SELECT log_id, action_taken, timestamp FROM CommunicationLog WHERE action_taken LIKE '%approved%' ORDER BY timestamp;
